etymologies: mid 18th century: from German Deckel, diminutive of Decke ‘covering’

definitions: a device in a papermaking machine for limiting the size of the sheet, consisting of a continuous belt on either side of the wire.
shortDefinitions: device in papermaking machine for limiting size of sheet, consisting of continuous belt on either side of wire

definitions: a frame on the mold used to shape the pulp when making paper by hand.
shortDefinitions: frame on mould used to shape pulp when making paper by hand
